York to remain affiliated with the NUS

By Joseph Silke

York students decide to remain part of the organisation with 60.1 per cent voting to stay affiliated. The decision means YUSU is expected to stay in the NUS until at least 2022 on turnout of 1017 votes, passing quorum by 43 votes.

By Joseph Silke

EU citizens in York denied a vote yesterday

By Joseph Silke

A national trend emerged yesterday of EU citizens being turned away at polling stations for the European elections. We spoke to people in York who were denied their vote.

"Utter mayhem" at Law exam as staff mishandle the exam papers

By Joseph Silke

Law students are outraged after mistakes by University staff at today's exam on EU law left many students without correct exam papers. There have also been claims that students with the correct papers were given an unfair advantage.

New proposals for public square with statue of The Queen outside York Minster

By Joseph Silke

The Minster has unveiled draft proposals for a new public square outside its west end, the first in the city for nearly 200 years, which will be dedicated to Her Majesty.

By Joseph Silke

By Andrew Young

By Joseph Silke

Caelestis, a choir based at St Lawrence Parish Church, will be singing at special services to commemorate the Normandy landings and the namesake of Alcuin College.
